text: 75cl bottle from EtreGourmet. Intense funky horse blanket nose. Very dry. The beer starts fresh and fruity. Very dry and grainy, funky sour, intense sharp, bitter in the end, fresh grainy, sessionable, moderate sour, somehow smooth with a funky grainy bitter aftertaste.

Many thanks to erzengel!! Pours a pretty orangish color with an off white head. The smell is wet wood, minerals, grapefruit. The taste is grapefruit, wood, funk with a dry and bitter end. The body is light+ with active carbonation.
Bottle @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Light hazy dark golden pour with a small head. Notes of barnyard, lemon peel, red apples, funk, some light oak and a light bitterness.

750ml bottle. Bottled in De Troch Wambeek in October 2015. Pours slightly hazy golden yellow colour. Moderate white head which disappears quite quickly. Acidity, earthiness, vinegar, apples, some spicy notes in the aroma. Earthiness, barnyard, notes of apples, oak, leathery notes in the taste. Lots of funk in the finish. Dry and rather bitter finish. Earthiness, notes of vanilla and apples as well. Light bodied, rather low carbonated interesting gueuze. Quit acidic one. In some points of tasting maybe bit plain, but definitely enjoyable and complex one.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak! Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aromas of wet forrest floor, oranges, citrus, light gooseberries, some appley and tannic notes. Taste is light tannic, orangey, red apples and rapes, vinegary, horsey and a subtle fruity acidity in the back. Super nice!

Bottle thanks to Erik. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Pours a hazy unclear orange with a tiny head. Aroma is very funky with awesome grape notes, slight oak, grapefruit, slight dry champagne and stable. Taste of funk, stable, grapefruit, oak, grapes, basement and citrus.

@ Wien, Beerlovers.at 👌🏻👌🏻👌

www.beeroda.hu - Beer Tasting Sessions @ Budapest, Hungary 🍺🍺🍺 

Facebook: www.facebook.com/beeroda/

Butelka. Aromat brettowy, sporo funku, agrestu. Smak dominująco kwaśny, ale dosyć zbalansowany, wysoka wytrawność. W smaku mamy sporo skóry, zestu, kwaśnych winogron i agrestu. Finish dosyć krótki, wytrawny i skórzany. Fajne.
Bottle pour at ACBF2017. Pours golden, white head. Fruity, citrus, barnyard, funk, some wood, moderate+ acidity, Light bodied. Not complex.

Deze geuze wordt lekkerder naar mate er meer (bodem)gist mee is uitgeschonken. Ander heb je een nogal makke geuze. 
Mooi ronde uitgebalanceerde geuze, met veel citrus, niet bepaald funky. Heel lekker maar iets te braaf.

Bottle at Foeders, Amsterdam. Pours light hazy yellowish with a small white head. Tart aroma of lemons, horse blanket, hints of peach and apricot, wood. Taste is sour, light sweet, light carbonation, sour lemony aftertaste. Nice.

3/III/17 - 75cl bottle @ ACBF (Vichte) - BB: n/a (2017-287) Thanks to all ratebeerians for sharing todays beers!
Clear orange beer, practically no head. Aroma: real geuze smell, brett, complex, fruity, woody, vanilla, nice one! MF: soft carbon, light body. Taste: bit lemony, watery, soft bitterness. Aftertaste: some tannins, ok but not very complex.
Sample at ACBF 2017. Clear golden color, small white head. Musty aroma. Taste is funky wet blankets and barnyards. Nice.

Bottle 0.75l shared at Foeders Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 04.03.2017. Taste with kermis and JulienHuxley. Thanks Chris for bringing this bottle. Pour it hazy golden color with small white head. Nice basement aromas, grassy, perfect geuze notes. Taste smooth, not that kick harsh sour feel which is good, really pleasent lemony feel, pinch of dry notes, lightly bitter, medium sourness, full body, creamy, thick feel, lively, long finish. Perfection really good stuff!

Sampled at ACBF2017. Thnx for sharing, everyone! Pours clear, blonde, small white head. Smell is mildly sour, rather funky. Taste is full, sour, oaky, citrussy. Very nice, actually, but this pricepoint - just as the BIIR geuze - is rediculous ( it sells for in between 20 and 30  in Belgian beershops, whilst a top-class geuze like 3f sells for about 10. Id happily drink again, but I have questions about whod actually buy it at this price. Another thing is that ill never see this being sold in a bar- its simply way to expensive. Try 1/3 - 1/4th of the price and well talk again.

Sampled at ACBF 2017, Vichte. Semi-hazy golden pour with no head. Notes of apple cider, barnyard funk, horse blanket, dank mouldy cellar, citrus hops, lemonade. Medium body, light carbonation. Not bad!

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 ACBF2017. Barwa jasno pomara?czowa, delikatnie przymglona. Piana bia?a, niska, momentalnie si? redukuje.W aromacie kwa?no, owocowo, jest funky, jest dziko, s? tak?e nuty kwa?ne kiszone.W smaku jest dok?adnie tak jak w aromacie. Jest naprawd? kwa?no, kiszone ogórki, ocet, jab?kowy. Czu? w tym Gueuze nuty stajenne, które cho? nie s? bardzo intensywne podkr?caj? to piwo i dodaj? mu charateru.Wysycenie wysokie, sprawdza si? idealnie. Piwo jest generalnie "chude" co jednak nie powinno dziwi?.
Bottle. Golden hazy pour with white head. Funky, leather, wild, oak aromas. Herbal, fruity, light oak, tart and funky flavors.
Bottle - pours gold white head - nose and taste of funk, old saw dust, wood, lemon and light farm notes - medium body

Bottle shared by Chris, thanks bro! Lightly hazy gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is super lemony, dried hay, mild grassy, rustic, farmyard notes without any cheesy or moldy aromas. Taste is crisp, tart, lemony, fresh and grassy. Palate is light bodied, very silky and satisfying. Very tasty gueuze.

ACBF 2017. Thank you for sharing kraddel, tderoeck, Travlr & friends. 750 ml. bottle sampled. Hazy orange, creamy white head. Nose is what it should be, bright lambiek funk, dry, faintly rustic, raw grains, dry pepper, crisp. Too bad that the taste doesnt fully deliver. Taste is bit malty upfront, falls bit flat, basic lemon, citrus, mellow, low sourness, almost faint sugar, lower on the side of funk, mellow horseblanket with clear malt,... faintly empty. Body is lightly empty, low sourness, clear malts, not as crispy as hoped. Overall good but there is better within the style, personally I liked the BIIR Gueuze a lot more which came from the same stable.

Small white rim over hazy yellow beer. Typical lambic nose with lemon, horseblanket, old wood and sulphur. Lemony gueuze, maybe less complex than the nose, tad of sweetness. Long lasting lemony flavours. Very good, resistent carbonation, acidthinning. Superb, amongst the best De Troch.

Sampled from tap at ACBF 2017 as Naparbier Oude Gueuze. Clear, golden amber with a white head. Sourish-fruity, very funky aroma of lemon, gooseberry, rhubarb, oak, straw and barnyard. Moderately sour, dusty, funky and quite fruity taste of lemon, oak, sweat, barnyard, leather and gooseberry, followed by a medium long, moderately tart, very dry finish. Medium body, slightly astringent and quite effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Lovely!

Bottle
Aroma-barnyard, fruits, prussic acid, chemical solvent
Appearance-golden, hazy, white foam
Taste-medium sourness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-interesting
Bottle. No head. Aroma is quite intensive, with herbs (dill?). Heavy sour. Medium bitterness. Good, but not exceptional - maybe Im not a fan of gueuze.
Bardzo ładny lambik, sporo Brettów, trochę fajnego sera, kwasowość solidna, ale bardzo ładnie zbalansowana. Trochę jak De Cam?

75 cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. September 2016.
Bottled: October 2015.
Nice dry astrigent gueuze. Usual apperance, some hazy with frothy vanishing white head. Dry finish.

750ml bottle @ Alexx. Thank you Mark for hauling this across the pond. Pours a hazy straw colour with a thin off-white head. Nose is classic gueuze style! Funk and sour. Flavour is mellow in comparison to the nose, it is nice. Very much on point to the style but seems weaker almost watered down.
Bottle - Petroleum and nice funk. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Great nose that is very subtle in flavours but incredibly drinkable. Dangerously fantastic.
Pours a hazy orange colour with a very thin head. Aroma of lemon zest, petrol, and barnyard funk. Taste is milder, with gueuze funk and light carbonation. Delicious and so easy drinking. Delightful.

Courtesy of MarkCloudy golden color, medium head. Wonderful aroma, true Lambic, armpit, cobwebs, and more bitter orange peel than usual Gueuzes. Aggressive mouthfeel, smooth and acidic, extreme bitter orange character, some funkiness.Smells better than tastes, excellent overall.

Hazy, light tan. Bubbly...not much head. Aroma is leathery, touch of that classic horse blanket and a dash of sweetish malt. Sweet front, then kicking in with some classic leather and lemon. The acidity picks up as it goes. Soft, mellow, has a subtle complexity. Old and fresh at the same time. Very drinkable, approachable gueuze but retaining classic gueuze quality.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy dark golden orange with a small white head. Aroma brings outs a lovely barnyard funk quality, followed by leather, and a touch of citrus. Flavour is softer than the average gueuze on the palate, with light-medium barnyard funk, leather, and some citrus notes. Very soft carbonation for the style -- could use a touch more. Nose is a bit better than the taste. All in all, its certainly excellent.

Botella @Cimmeria, Oviedo 24/09/2016
Color amarillo, agria, frutal, buena gueuze.

Bottle 750ml. @ The Danish (Ulfborg) Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2016, TNO(U)DRBSG16 @ fonefan & Brugmasia House. [ As NaparBCN Oude Gueuze ].Unclear matt medium orange color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to heavy yeasty, barnyard, leather, farmyard, funky, tart, grapes. Flavor is moderate sweet and acidic with a long duration, tart, dry, farmyard, funky, leather, thin. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft to flat. [20160820]

Aroma and taste is tart fruity with notes of grapes, bretty notes, some barnyard and orchard fruit, grapeskin, tart finish.

Sampled @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2016, Saturday, Day 2


75cl bottle. Pours hazy golden colour with a small white head. aroma of mild sour fruits, herbs, wood, very dry. Taste of mild sour pale fruits, herbs, dry wood, good one!

Sampled from bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Gathering 2016, Ulfborg, Day 2. Hazy yellow to light orange color, small to average sized white to off-white head. Aroma is lovely, really nice geuze-aroma. Somewhat sourish, but at the same time not sour at all. Tastes about the same: breet, not sour but sort of, very refreshing, somewhat dry finish. Lovely balanced.

Bottled at TNOD(U)RBSG2016. Cloudy golden, coarse head. Lemony barnyard aroma. Dry with medium body and soft, vital mouthfeel. Hay, citric acid and barnyard. Mild stale hop bitterness. Lovely, complex gueuze.
Trocken säuerlicher Antrunk mit wenig herben Lambiknoten. Vollmundig, langer trockener, etwas getreidiger Nachhall. 11/12/11/12/9/12
TNOD(U)RBSG16. Hazy light orange, small white head. Aroma has light funk, mellow citrus, mostly lemon. Dry but still juicy lemon flavour, funky with hints of brett.

Bottle, 6%. Hazy dark yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, tart, lemon, barnyard and a little leather. Flavour is malt, lemon, barnyard, little tart, little lemon, little sweet and medium dry,

Bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering, fonefan. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are brett, sour malt, fruits, stable, barnyard, lactose acid and hops. Nice sour finish.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, lemon and barnyard. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish. 200816

RBESG 2016 in Barcelona. Shared 750 ml bottle at NaparBCN. Hazy golden to orange colour. "Farmhouse" and lemons in the aroma. The flavour is very dry, sour, tart and very refreshing. Brettanomyces and lemony notes. Excellent beer.

9th July 2016: 0.75 litre bottle. The first beer of many at the lovely Napar Brewpub in Barcelona: with the RBESG guys. Small white head on a hazy orange body. Farmyards in the aroma, a fruit orchard farmyard maybe, with squashed citrus fruits underfoot. The taste was a surprise compared to the nose: a mild sweetness initially followed by a gentle citrus led bitter, mini-sour fruitiness. Nice start to what was a mega 15 beer tasting before moving on.

Bottle at NaparBCN. Hazy golden with bubbly white head. Lots of funk, hay, white pepper, lemon, mineral water, pineapple, Granny Smith apples. Almost medium sour and very light sweetness and bitterness. Under medium bodied with slightly watery feel.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2016 Bottle shared at RBESG 16 NaparBCN. Hazy orange with a white head. Aroma has a nice barnyard funk, manure, horse blanket, citrus, dank cellar and light toffee typical of De Troch lambic. Flavour is light sweet and light moderate sour. Light to medium bodied with light carbonation.

75 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is dry barnyard. Smooth fruity, citric and mellow fruity. Smooth fruity and crisp fruity finish.smooth fruity, citric and dry fruity finish.
Bottle at NaparBCN. Orange colour with white head. Funk, fruity aroma. Sweet, fruity, peach, funk taste. Medium body.
